displaytitle: Design for a Lunette in Triptych Form: Philosophy in Center Points Upward Toward God and Christ Above, Flanked by Two Saints
medium: Pen, brown ink and brown wash heightened with white on Gray brown paper
creditline: Gift of Frank Jewett Mather Jr.
inscribed: left wing: [-]IVES CRISTVS FILIVS DEI VIVI; across top: SAPIENTIA HVIVS MVDI STULTITIA EST APUD DEVM; along base: PHILOSOPHIA; ...

titles.title: Design for a Lunette in Triptych Form: Philosophy in Center Points Upward Toward God and Christ Above, Flanked by Two Saints

texts.textentryhtml: unidentified mark of two concentric ircles containing addorsed circle segments, lower left and right verso; Henry Schniewind (museum records); gift of Frank Jewett Mather, Jr., but not stamped with his mark, bought from Richard Ederheimer, New York

bibliography.boilertext: "Recent accessions," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 7, no. 1 (1948): p. 7.
bibliography.citation: "Recent accessions," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 7, no. 1 (1948): p. 7., p. 7

bibliography.boilertext: Felton Gibbons, Catalogue of Italian Drawings in The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1977).
bibliography.citation: Felton Gibbons, Catalogue of Italian Drawings in The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1977)., Vol. 1: p. 241, no. 793 (illustrated in Vol. 2 under the same catalog number)

caption: Unknown Italian artist, Design for a Lunette in Triptych Form: Philosophy in Center Points Upward Toward God and Christ Above, Flanked by Two Saints, early 16th century. Pen, brown ink and brown wash heightened with white on Gray brown paper; 15.5 x 28 cm. Gift of Frank Jewett Mather Jr. (x1947-77)
